content: If mathport correctly guesses a name right (which luckily happens most of the time in my current file), should I keep the #align statements? Or should I remove them? Do we have a preference for this?
I think currently 25% of mathlib4 consists of #align statements
In other words, we seem to be keeping them
Ok. I'll do that from now on. But it doesn't hurt if I have removed a couple where mathport is already correct, right?
I had imagined that when the port is over we'll be removing all of them, so I've been leaving them in even if they're not necessary.
there is also some benefit to redundant #align that they can help you find lean 4 definitions using grep
this is also why #align deliberately does not do name resolution / incorporate the current namespace
Yes, I find the #align's very useful for finding stuff, please leave them in!
